title: Buy a Contract for multiple Accounts Send
description: Buy a Contract for multiple Accounts specified by the 'tokens' parameter. Note, although this is an authorized call, the contract is not bought for the authorized account.

buy_contract_for_multiple_accounts.description: Either the id received from a Price Proposal (proposal) call, or 1 if contract buy parameters are passed in the parameters field

price.description: Maximum price at which to purchase the contract.

items.description: API tokens identifying the accounts for which the contract is bought. Note, if the same token appears multiple times or if multiple tokens designate the same account, the contract is bought multiple times for this account.

parameters.description: Optional field, used to pass the parameters for contract buy

basis.description: Indicate whether amount is 'payout' or 'stake', or 'multiplier' for lookbacks

currency.description: This can only be the account-holder's currency

date_start.description: For forward-starting contracts, epoch value of the starting time of the contract.

date_expiry.description: Epoch value of the expiry time of the contract. You must either specify date_expiry or duration.

duration_unit.description: Duration unit is s(seconds), m(minutes), h(hours), d(days), t(ticks)

barrier.description: Barrier for the contract (or last digit prediction for digit contracts). Contracts less than 24 hours in duration would need a relative barrier (barriers which need +/-), where entry spot would be adjusted accordingly with that amount to define a barrier, except for Volatility Indices as they support both relative and absolute barriers.

barrier2.description: Low barrier for the contract (for contracts with two barriers). Contracts less than 24 hours in duration would need a relative barrier (barriers which need +/-), where entry spot would be adjusted accordingly with that amount to define a barrier, except for Volatility Indices as they support both relative and absolute barriers.

selected_tick.description: The tick that is predicted to have the highest/lowest value - for tickhigh and ticklow contracts.

app_markup_percentage.description: Markup added to contract prices (as a percentage of contract payout)

passthrough.description: Optional field, used to pass data through the websocket, which may be retrieved via the echo_req output field.

req_id.description: Optional field to map request to response
